website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus Tough TG-3 is a worthy successor to the TG-2. Despite some image noise, it's still the best rugged camera we've tested.
cons: Zoom and focus are audible on video soundtrack

website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus Tough TG-2 iHS rugged camera is a very minor upgrade to the excellent TG-1. It comes in at a lower price and walks away with our Editors' Choice award.
cons: Lens movement is audible on video soundtrack

customer_reviews.title: Tough, great photo quality, not as good for video
customer_reviews.text: Soooo tough and durable and completely waterproof. Took it white shark cage diving and it was excellent for photos. Excellent quality photos. The video not so much. When taking video, it doesn't automatically focus or refocus so you have to stop the video, refocus, and restart the video. Unless there is a trick I couldn't figure out. This was especially annoying for me as I was on safari taping the animals, who move, and every time they moved, the video went blurry and I had to stop and restart.
customer_reviews.author: DianaHall825

customer_reviews.title: This camera is amazing! love the quality and durability
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! love the quality and durability. Took it to Punta Cana and put it through it's paces in the ocean and pools as well as the sand. Held up and took amazing pictures. Editing was almost as fun as the software allows for some basic, but neat touch-ups and photo edits. BONUS: you can use your smartphone to connect to the camera (via blutooth) and use it as a remote to control taking pictures through the camera; took selfies to a whole new level. Almost Inception like: A smartphone with a camera, controlling a digital camera taking pictures of someone holding a smartphone with a camera controlling a digital camera....
customer_reviews.author: DubV1986

customer_reviews.title: Those issues aside it is a good rugged camera which I have given out to the ...
customer_reviews.text: The wireless connection between the camera and your phone has to be established from both ends each time you want to transfer files. Also the front bezel comes off though I don't believe this has any structural function with the camera. and finally the battery is drained very very quickly with the track feature turned on, without this feature turned on the time it takes to get GPS prevents it from being pulled out snapped quickly and put back. Those issues aside it is a good rugged camera which I have given out to the kids to take with the to theme parks and pools and has come back with pictures and not a scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Sleadd

customer_reviews.title: Camera with highlight
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a good average in picture quality in comparison to other compact cameras and for waterproof compact cameras even above average. So there would be no bigger description of pros and cons until it comes to accessories. This little compact camera offers a fisheye lens as well as a telephoto lens and the adapter gives you the option to protect the original lens. The lenses are submersible as well. All lenses are from Olympus it self so this is not an aftermarket adaptation. It is solid and well functioning. This option makes the camera a highlight among the mass.
customer_reviews.author: Spittler

customer_reviews.title: Nice Point & Shoot
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good camera and I've been through a few. The biggest disappointment is its proprietary usb cable. Having to carry yet another cord on vacation is not good. Minus 1 start for that. I used it on vacation for underwater and non underwater photos it worked great. I even dropped it twice without incident. It has some cool art settings and such if you like that. It doesn't seem to have shutter priority or manual. Maybe I just couldn't find them. It's light and fits easily in your pocket. Capable point & shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Vilhjálmur

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp pictures. Tons of interesting features and settings to help you get perfect pictures. We wanted a waterproof camera for an upcoming cruise so we could take pictures while snorkeling and on the beach. You don't want water or sand anywhere near your smart phone. I let my daughter borrow it for a trip to Florida last week. When it got sand on it she just walked into the water and rinsed it off. Awesome. The pictures she took were in sharp focus and the contrast and color balance were spot on. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ullrich

customer_reviews.title: I think you will really like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this camera. I would classify myself as a "prosumer". I have a Canon 5D Markiii and a a Fuji X100s. I wanted the TG-3 to explore underwater photography. I was VERY pleased with the underwater photos I took in the ocean and the pool. I was also please with normal daytime and nighttime photos. I really don't have any negative comments. I think if you want an affordable pocket camera that can take underwater photos that you'll love the TG-3.
customer_reviews.author: Walter A.

customer_reviews.title: Overall this I would definitely recommend this camera if you are looking for something waterproof ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is durable! We took it to bora bora for our honeymoon and used it daily for underwater excursions, no issues! Then we went snowboarding couple months later and I dropped it off the gondola from over 20 feet. It landed in a maybe a foot of soft snow and survived! We did have to ask the crew there to look for it, which was kinda embarrassing. Overall this I would definitely recommend this camera if you are looking for something waterproof and shatterproof. As for pictures, the camera takes great pictures, lots of setting for different types of shots
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: They deliver more than promised, or expected!
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying this line of cameras for years and are very happy with them. They have been very durable, take great pictures and deliver more than they promise. We had one of these that opened in the fresh water bin after diving. I'm not sure how it happened; my guess is it was my fault. When I called Olympus, they said to send it back. They sent me a refurbished (looks like new) camera for no charge. They even included a new case, charger and strap, all at no charge! We are very happy with them and will continue to buy their products!
customer_reviews.author: Nina M

customer_reviews.title: You A Dad?  Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Every dad needs a tough, waterproof camera. This won't replace your DSLR but it's just as good as a regular point-and-shoot. Plus, you can give it to your four-year-old and his friends in the pool and not worry one second. Pair it with the floating camera strap to make retrieving it easier. The movies and the slow-motion make great memories out of beach, pool, and skiing fun. DO NOT KEEP IT IN YOUR POCKET AT THE BEACH. Sand in your pockets will scratch the heck out of the screen.
customer_reviews.author: KennethF

customer_reviews.title: The little cam that could..
customer_reviews.text: Judging by all the reviews, I was expecting this to be bigger and bulkier than it is. Pictures are what you'd expect. I haven't been disappointed. One of the things a lot of the reviews have left out is the Olympus App. This app is a real gem! Download it to your smart phone, sync it and it essentially turns your smart phone into a shutter remote. Me and my nephew had a good time with that feature. So far so good. I'll update this review once I've tested the waterproof factor on our next beach trip.
customer_reviews.author: Eureka

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera except for memory card door
customer_reviews.text: Great underwater camera but first one kept having the door that holds the memory card open despite locking it multiple times. Finally happened while underwater in Guam and camera went kaput. Luckily within 30 day window so was able to return for a replacement. Memory card luckily was ok. Haven't used replacement yet but will be more cautious from here on in. Otherwise takes great pictures for a point and shoot underwater camera. That door though is a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Timmerman

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. Our last Olympus tough camera finally gave out after years of abuse. This one can be controlled by your smart phone. Prop it up on something and take a group photo. You can see on the phone what the camera does, adjust settings and people, take the photo. Eliminates the running back and forth to take a photo with a timer. We've had this new camera for over a year and still going strong. Highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great for Macro photography
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give it 5 stars but can't. Love the pictures this camera produces but the video is just ok. I bought it mostly to do underwater and wet activities. I ended up getting a action camera to do that for less. But I love the quality of still pics so that is a major plus. The macro mode is amazing. I am one that likes to take pics of my food and the macro mode is great on this camera to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Wright

customer_reviews.title: Not So Tough
customer_reviews.text: It was great until it wasn't. My husband carries this camera for work. He has carried the Tough cameras for many years and when he needed a new one, we went with the TG-3. He buys them specifically because he takes his cameras into dirty environments where they can get knocked around, even wet. The Tough cameras have always performed well until this one. We bought it four months ago and it's now dead. We'll be looking elsewhere for a new camera.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: It is a very nice camera. Has some weight to it but feels ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a very nice camera. Has some weight to it but feels durable. It has a very fast start up and quick focus and picture taking with little lag. Video is clear although I can hear small clicking sound. All controls are firm and not mushy like some other tough camera. Tg3 is almost same as tg4 except cheaper price. I bought silicon jacket toro text camera from scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Furfur

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Being a avid hiker I am hard on my gear. This camera has held up for years and is still going strong. I hike with my sled dogs so it is hard to get good non blurry pictures. The action setting never fails me!
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Almost tough....
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been great. Photos are solid and it is relatively tough. My biggest gripe is the back LCD is EASILY scratched! Not so tough there, Olympus. As for camera features, I'll leave it to some one to pontificate about how good it is.... My 2 cents - they're solid and this is a great family, trip, scuba, boat, beach, etc camera!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Leaked
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. It did not seal. Lost a whole set of pictures
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: Just an incredible camera for taking macro and super macro images
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable! Just an incredible camera for taking macro and super macro images. Good on battery life. Rugged and dependable. Starts right up, can take a picture within half a second. There are so many features that I can't report on all of them after only having had the camera for a few weeks. I will revise with a more in-depth review at a later date. First impression is; fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: John A. Rauth, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact camera.
customer_reviews.text: The camera was listed as used but I cannot see any marks of wear that were described. So it is in excellent condition and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Misuraca

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rugged camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been to burning man twice. Got forgotten about in my car for most of a winter. It still had a full battery. It takes fantastic pictures. Even in low light, it performs almost as good as my DSLR. Under water takes great pictures too.
customer_reviews.author: EMTsmitty

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little camera. Really is waterproof (used it snorkeling for video - wow).
customer_reviews.author: Frank Decker

customer_reviews.title: Some saltwater corrosion
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to go snorkeling with and it has really done well in photographing underwater. The fish closeup setting is really good and the other 2 underwater settings are also good but I didn't use them as much. The reason that I am giving the camera only a 3 star rating is that in spite of following the rinsing instructions faithfully, there is already some corrosion occuring around the 3 screws that are found under the removeable ring. I snorkeled 4 times and soaked/rinsed as per instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Jane B. Toro

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Took on vacation to Burma November 2014. Love this camera. ONLY a couple seconds to power on, press the button and take a picture! Carried it with me for two weeks straight without a problem. Battery life was quite good however it cant hurt to buy a second. I know it has many more features than I will ever use. I cant say enough about this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn M. Mc Clure

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. Took it to Baja on a surf vacation. Was in the water everyday and got some great photos. Can't really comment on what it would do diving but it's not going to be set up for that anyway. Durable, responsive, fast, excellent photos...well done.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. David J. Shuman

customer_reviews.title: Best camera ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best point and shoot camera I've owned. Lots of video shot with this camera on my youtube channel: [...] It takes great photos, on closeups you can see the hairs on an ant. It is very tough, I've beat it up quite a bit and still it runs like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: dswoboda

customer_reviews.title: but this cameras' image quality is fantastic. Feels great in the hand and in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. Will be honest, as a Sony mirrorless shutter I was a little skeptical, but this cameras' image quality is fantastic. Feels great in the hand and in the pocket. You only have like three choices in aperture priority, but for a pocket tough camera - I would say it is enough. Enjoying it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: The shooting quality is amazing. But
customer_reviews.text: The shooting quality is amazing. But, the first time I used it in underwater ( shallow mind you) water leaked inside. The camara was therefore RUINED after just 2 weeks. Oh, and there's no warranty. Still, if you take care of it, the buy is worth it. I wish I could replace it. Ha!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Gomez Andujar

customer_reviews.title: WHICH btw come out quite nice.
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it, she hates hard to use tech, and this camera was bought to be a point and shoot outdoor cam to compliment our youtube channel with pics as well. She loves this camera, to the point she actually does more than point and shoot. Including macro shots, WHICH btw come out quite nice.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Harbin

customer_reviews.title: Still works like new.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few years ago.... Still works like new ... One down side is the prints on the button all rubbed off... Thank God I know what the buttons are..
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, yes I'm in love with it. Lol. The built in filters are amazing , the quality of the pics look professional and I don't know how to use cameras. This tells you what to do. I've dropped it, put it in water and it does what its supposed to do . Take great pics. Best point and click camera out there .
customer_reviews.author: zimmerman20

customer_reviews.title: One Terriffic Underwater and Abovewater Camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an underwater camera that I could use above the water as well for our trip to French Polynesia and Hawaii in October 2014. I just returned from the trip and I absolutely LOVE this camera. It took amazing photographs underwater as well as above the water. When I needed a better zoom option, I used my Nikon Coolpix S9700, but that was the only time I used my other camera. I used my Olympus TG-3 camera 95% of the time and never had a problem. It was fun using all of the options on the camera. I am extremely happy with my purchase and I am so glad I did not let the negative reviews persuade my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Gahrmann

customer_reviews.title: Great picture and I love the wifi ability
customer_reviews.text: Have taken this in the Caribbean ocean with no problems. I did follow instructions on submerging it in fresh water after being in salt water. Great picture and I love the wifi ability. I'm not a professional by any means but this camera has worked out nicely so far!
customer_reviews.author: Elicia B.

customer_reviews.title: great shots and video underwater
customer_reviews.text: very solid camera.....sometimes the auto fucus is off, but usually you can work it around. great shots and video underwater....no issues with it....will use for years I'm sure
customer_reviews.author: svs

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pictures and perfect size for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my husband. He took a 12-day trip to the Alaskan bush this summer and this was the camera he used for his adventure. It was perfect because he got awesome pictures without having to carry a heavy camera.
customer_reviews.author: Muffie

customer_reviews.title: SAY CHEESE!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! WOW!! So Freaking nice Trust me you want a compact all in one WI-FI, GPS, AND MORE THIS IS THE ONE I really recommend this Item as a gift, or you your self lol, nice close ups, I got mine do you have yours?? you'll not regret it ,
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera, Well-Made, Tough and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: This camera exceeded my expectations on a recent cruise to the Caribbean. I didn't get to use it for snorkeling but all of the shots taken were excellent, and the built-in filters along with the other specs make this camera a worthy upgrade to my Panasonic TS2. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Fish

customer_reviews.title: I like it but the real issue I have with underwater ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it but the real issue I have with underwater cameras is that it is limited to a 5X optical zoom. Otherwise a great outdoor, underwater camera. Probably the best of the lot.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Derry

customer_reviews.title: Really good bang for your $$$$
customer_reviews.text: the best camera for diving up to 75 feet. love all the options. it is my second one because I lost the first one in the Carribean. I use it to take pics of my gardens as well. good all around and bang for your buck
customer_reviews.author: Kamilla

customer_reviews.title: Olympus Toughs are the best
customer_reviews.text: Main improvement over prior models, at least for me, is a quicker shutter speed. The grip is a little awkward one handed, though; I like the layout of the prior model a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: We got some fog under the lens the first time using it but we had it in some pretty rough water so I expect we were over using .
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. We got some fog under the lens the first time using it but we had it in some pretty rough water so I expect we were over using it. We decided to not send it in for replacement and have not had any problems with it. I really like the embedded filters (Art Mode) with it.
customer_reviews.author: tweakMOD

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a similar issue as others reported. I took it snorkeling and water leaked behind the screen. I had followed all the recommendations in the directions including the after salt water soak. First the screen stopped working then the entire camera stopped working. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: James Volker

customer_reviews.title: love this camera and worked well through my travels
customer_reviews.text: love this camera and worked well through my travels. went to nyc and it rained a lot on my other camera, so got this one and now I never have to worry about weather conditions for taking pics.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Grimm

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera. Lots of features and it is tough ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera. Lots of features and it is tough as nails. I have already dropped it, had it bounce out of a partially open toolk bag on a dirt bike, and got hung in a rain storm with it. No issues. I don't plan on using it underwater but the fact that it is waterproof allows me to use it in the rain with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Larry C. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, can't wait to use it in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, can't wait to use it in the water. Wish I came with a storage card though, had to buy separate. Also does not come with a case. When bought directly from olympus's website they offered a free floating attachement but did not get it when buying off amazon. That would be helpful so as not to loose it in the water but sinking... it is $20
customer_reviews.author: Jenna S.

customer_reviews.title: Microscope mode is my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, very portable and most amazing in microscope mode. GPS and compass are quite handy, as is the ability to use it underwater. Also wifi transfer works well. Heartily recommend this camera, versatile and lots of features.
customer_reviews.author: nancydyson

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to our 2 year old as a present when we brought home her little brother. Worked like a charm! Easy to use and built very solid. The pictures are ok. We don't use it as our primary camera.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fong

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied so far
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I have yet to use it underwater, but it seems well built and the pictures are remarkable. The controls are well placed. I particularly like how each picture mode has a brief on-screen description of its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: chipt

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, I now own two!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for a trip to Playa del Carmen. Lost and then found the camera in about 9ft of water and it still worked. Dropped the camera by the pool and it still worked. Wound up using this camera and its twin to take all vacation photos since the camera takes such good pictures. Love the photo art filters. Great camera!
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great panoramic shots. Does more than can do with cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: DMNorman

customer_reviews.title: The image quality was pretty good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Ours came defective. Either the lens or the sensor had a problem. Every single image was 5 degree's askew. Used it for a week on vacation, and had to edit every single image to fix the problem. The image quality was pretty good, not great, but this may have been affected by the faulty image sensor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Bought this camera in October 2014, used it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera in October 2014, used it for a trip to Ireland, at Christmas and tried to use it in February - dead and will not take a charge. Website says it is too late to return not sure how to get this resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera! Totally worth the money. Takes great pictures and videos on land and in the water!
customer_reviews.author: ZV

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do, in a easy-to-use and good quality way
customer_reviews.text: simple to use, very decent underwater photos, wifi works very easily with ipad (although I couldnt work out how to multi-select photos to transfer), battery life good enough and like the fact the battery charges within the camera. Saves having to take a seperate battery charger unit. So, does what it needs to do (for me at least) without a particular disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Pit

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Really good camera so far. The wifi feature let's you sync to a phone. Takes great pics and has tons of features. So far we (wife and I) love it.
customer_reviews.author: David Drasser

customer_reviews.title: Rugged for sure
customer_reviews.text: Even I can't break it. And I did drop it from 6 feet without breaking it. It's easy to use and the picture quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S

customer_reviews.title: Best Point and Shoot ive ever used
customer_reviews.text: i absolutely love this camera!!!! I just bought this to upgrade my old Canon Powershot. This camera goes above and beyond my expectations - it takes amazing low light pics - great for fireworks too. The wifi connect has saved me so much time as i can load my pics to my iphone on the train and post from there. This camera is built like a tank - perftect weight. Crisp detail in all my pics - i highly recommend this camera - i was looking at the Nikon Coolpix AW120 and Im glad i chose this one!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great camera! I took a lot of pictures during ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! I took a lot of pictures during our trip to Aruba. Some amazing underwater pictures while snorkeling. Make sure to get floating strap for it.
customer_reviews.author: Architect

customer_reviews.title: ... all these dives and splashes it is going strong like it's brand new
customer_reviews.text: I order this Olimpus and after all these dives and splashes it is going strong like it's brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Import Direct Services

customer_reviews.title: Great camera if it held a charge
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is very poor. Camera seems great but had to send it back because it didn't hold a charge long enough to really enjoy using. Hope the replacement is better!
customer_reviews.author: jewelry mom

customer_reviews.title: A solid camera.
customer_reviews.text: Camera is a solid piece of photographic equipment. Performance is quite satisfactory and a fine addition to my gear to use in inclement weather.
customer_reviews.author: DanS

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong. It has been in many pools and in the Great Barrier Reef.
customer_reviews.author: catladyjones

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures! Terrific speed and clarity
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures! Terrific speed and clarity! Only issue is water spots if you are in the water... no way to get the lens dry again...
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Camera works great, and takes great pictures
customer_reviews.text: Camera works great, and takes great pictures. Have one piece of trim on the lens that came off while snorkeling. It does not affect the camera, or waterproof capability.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Best camera in the world for "In Camera" focus stacking.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Nearly shock proof, takes great pictures, even under water. Took it on vacation came back with fantastic pictures. Not to heavy or bulky for carrying; never ran out of memory or battery (as long as I pluged it in when I went to bed). Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great camera! Took it diving for the first time ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Took it diving for the first time in February (in Hawaii) and got some great shots!
customer_reviews.author: dsgodda

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and water and shock resistant to boot
customer_reviews.text: Great camera and water and shock resistant to boot. Unfortunately does not come with a wall charger, like most cameras. Otherwise I'm quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: family guy375

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased
customer_reviews.text: The images rival my old Canon DSLR yet it is 1/3 the size. I'm taking it over seas for some snorkeling now.
customer_reviews.author: R. Opler

customer_reviews.title: very versatile camera and excellent quality of pictures
customer_reviews.text: very versatile camera and excellent quality of pictures. Only weak point is short battery life when using GPS tracking function (1 day)--need to re-charge every day when in the field
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Great photos, compact and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a present and it has been a great success. Compact and easy to use. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: arundel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wife loved her gift takes good pictures for an amateur photographer
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera, but have problems in automatic modes in the night and some items sold separately
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Duenas

customer_reviews.title: s
customer_reviews.text: camera never took the first picture. mbattery that was included would not charge.returned for refund and received same within 48 hours. Service was excellent. product was defectivee
customer_reviews.author: fred h. sumrall

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Worth the money and takes pictures as if you spent $$$$$
customer_reviews.text: Just bought and brought this camera on vacation in the Caribbean. It is everything they said it would be and more! Very easy to use and pictures were amazing as we snorkeled daily. I charged it before we left and did not need to recharge all week. We enjoyed taking pictures and can't wait to use it to its full capacity!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Shiroff

customer_reviews.title: Best camera ever!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! Great pics! (Be careful though, it easily switches to "micro" if you are not careful)
customer_reviews.author: OnMyWay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: We bought a TG-3 to take on a 7 day raft trip down the Colorado River, and it exceeded our expectations. Picture quality is very good, it truly is waterproof, and battery life is outstanding. The battery easily lasted the 7 days of our trip without a recharge. As with many digital products these days, the TG-3 comes with a vast menu of options and there is a learning curve, so take some time to at least learn the basics.
customer_reviews.author: LRG

customer_reviews.title: Very good photos and videos
customer_reviews.text: I returned this camera after just a couple of days of use. What alarmed me was the autofocus had serious difficulty at night where there was strong nightlights. Most of the photos were out of focus. Other than at night it worked flawlessly. I had owned an Olympus TG-830. Used it everywhere for one summer. Took a lot of photos in the surf off Florida's beaches. Very good photos and videos. Loved that camera but I passed it along to my son for use in the Florida Keys. He uses it everywhere including 2014 Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade, and music concerts.
customer_reviews.author: Roper Davis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, owned for 3 months, great pics, nice features, seems quite tough.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Bombardier Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Took amazing photos underwater in the Galapagos. Will have to see how it does now in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Mercy Wagner

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: Great all around camera, have used this on two vacations above and below the water, has worked flawlessly and takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: bheis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for trekking or the beach. Image quality is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: M.J. Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super camera. This is my 3rd one-I always get the newest one when it comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie

customer_reviews.title: Leaked Water
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a decent camera but water leaked into the camera while using it in a pool. Before closing the battery compartment I cleaned the seal. Other than that the only major downside is the panoramic mode doesn't work very well.
customer_reviews.author: James Ward

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this camera. It is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: The best decision I made
customer_reviews.text: The best decision I made. Used it extensively on our trip, had amazing underwater pics. The silver ring covering the lens is pretty loose and got lost in one of the dives, but guess its more of aesthetics then any use.
customer_reviews.author: Chinmay

customer_reviews.title: Not so Tough
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera in July for a vacation in October. Planned to take underwater pictures while snorkeling. The camera worked fine at home in the pool and for the first three days of the vacation. The first time I tried to use it snorkeling, the camera won't even turn on. It's completely dead. I'm sending it in for warranty repair, but failure after 3 months of light use, at the very moment I planned to use it for the only purpose I bought it is just inexcusable.
customer_reviews.author: TWM

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for above and below the water
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for above and below the water! Easy to use and great macro for a camera like this!
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Deluca

customer_reviews.title: Great camera so far
customer_reviews.text: Great camera so far!... I really like that is also has an app you can use to take pictures from your phone with the camera. .. can't wait to take it to Hawaii :)
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing closeups.
customer_reviews.text: Quite amazing, the way it can take very closeup stacked images. I take macrophotographs of plants (say, 1/4 inch square), and this camera is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: Short and simple. Amazing camera!! Great shots in and out of water. Would buy over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: David L Susa Jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good eventhough a little bit expensive and quite big for a compact camera
customer_reviews.author: DIMITRIOS PLATIS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera and very good underwater pictures. Very easy to use while snorkeling. Also work well "above the water"
customer_reviews.author: MissGina

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for my cruise and it did Not disappoint! I was stunned by the quality of photos both in and out of the water! So much fun to use! My only wish is that it had a bit more zoom, but it truly did an awesome job.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera with numerous options and amazing picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera with numerous options and amazing picture quality. Superb underwater pictures. A bit heavy, but I guess it is a must for a water and drop-proof camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rosen Filev

customer_reviews.title: fogged up every time under water.
customer_reviews.text: The camera leaked the first time I used it then it fogged up every time under water. Only a few pictures were good.
customer_reviews.author: rki1966

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating camera, it gave warning light at 20 feet ...
customer_reviews.text: Frustrating camera, it gave warning light at 20 feet which did not give confidence to take it deeper, quality was reasonable, but not great
customer_reviews.author: Robb Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've used this camera for several trips and I just love it. I'm totally satisfied with the pictures quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eleonor Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Not too waterproof
customer_reviews.text: LCD screen stopped working on second trip. I think water may have leaked in. So sad. Still not working after drying 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Olympus TG-3 Waterproof 16 MP Digital Camera (Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:BaseHigh Speed Ultra Bright f2.0 lens

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 



TOUGH GETS CONNECTED
Have you ever stopped and wished you had a WiFi-enabled camera that could handle extreme outdoor conditions and deliver spectacular high-resolution photos and smooth HD videos of your epic outdoor adventures, even in low light? If so, meet the Olympus Tough TG-3. It’s incredibly rugged, yet boasts a super-bright f2.0 4x zoom lens, sophisticated features like next-generation GPS, Interval Shooting and time-lapse movie options, four variable macro shooting modes, and system accessories that further expand its capabilities. This is the camera you take to places you never dared take a camera before.

So Rugged We Call It “Lifeproof”
Extreme pursuits in extreme conditions require an extremely rugged camera. The TG-3 stands up to the four major challenges facing any adrenaline-crazed adventure shooter: wet – waterproof to 50 feet (15m); cold – freezeproof to 14°F (-10°C); clumsy – shockproof to 7 feet (2.1m); and forgetful – crushproof to 220 pounds of pressure (100kgf). So whether you dunk it, leave it outside, drop it or sit on it, the TG-3 will handle the abuse and keep right on capturing your epic adventures.



High-speed, Bright f2.0 Optics for Superb Low-light Shooting
Shooting fast action in less-than-ideal lighting is a recipe for disappointment with most outdoor cameras – but not the TG-3. Its ultra-bright high-speed f2.0 lens enables the camera to dial up the shutter speed to nail blur-free shots when a school of exotic fish is passing by or your buddy is flashing through the shadows on his bike. You can also reduce the ISO to shoot crisp, detailed images with minimal noise in low light, or use the Aperture priority mode to expand the focus range of the background.



Built-in Connectivity for Your “Smart” Lifestyle
The TG-3 is designed to meld seamlessly with your ever-more-interconnected digital world. WiFi is built right in, so you can share files easily with the Olympus Image Share app; even cooler, you can operate the zoom, adjust ISO and white balance, select the shooting and drive modes, activate the self-timer, and even select the autofocus point and trip the shutter, all from your smart device – great for wildlife photography and including yourself in group shots. The TG-3 also has a built-in electronic compass and next-generation GPS that accurately locates your position in 10 seconds and geotags photos (for mapping out your journeys).

(1) Location/landmarks

(2) Electronic compass

(3) Air pressure/altitude

(1) Location/landmarks

(2) Latitude/longitude

(3) Air pressure/Water pressure

(4) Altitude/water depth

(5) Date and time

(6) Location/landmarks



Get Creative with Interval Shooting and Time-lapse Movies
With the TG-3’s Interval Shooting function, you can set when you want the camera to start shooting (from 1 second to 24 hours), then select intervals from as long as 24 hours to as short as 1 second and snap up to 99 frames. These images can then be compiled automatically into a time-lapse movie lasting up to 10 seconds (720p at 10 fps).

Get Up Close – Really Close!
Mountain panoramas are great, but sometimes you want to zero in on subtler forms of natural beauty (like snowflakes or dew). The TG-3 offers four different modes for macro shooting, including Microscope, Microscope Control (a maximum magnification of 44.5x is possible from a distance of 1cm), Focus Bracketing and Focus Stacking (in which multiple images, from foreground to background, are taken and the areas in focus are automatically merged into one perfect shot).

Expand Your Rugged System with Useful Accessories
Another thing that sets the TG-3 apart from other rugged cameras is its family of accessories (sold separately). The waterproof fisheye converter (FCON-T01) gives you the ability to capture gorgeous wide-angle shots; thanks to the bright f2.0 lens, even dark underwater scenes pop. The waterproof tele converter (TCON-T01) increases the camera’s zoom capability from 4x to nearly 7x, and allows you to highlight the subject by blurring the background. And the new LED ring guide (LG-1) channels the camera’s LED illuminator for enhanced, even lighting during macro photography.

In-camera Special Effects – and Now Photo Story
For those who like to spice up their photography, the TG-3 includes 11 built-in Art Filters that enable you to apply effects like Pin Hole, Grainy Film and Fisheye right in the camera – no need to transfer images to a computer for manipulation. The TG-3 is also the first rugged camera that includes Olympus’s much-loved Photo Story feature, which provides templates you can use to combine different perspectives on the same scene into one image.
feature_bullets: 16 MP 1/2.3" BSI CMOS sensor with sensor shift image stabilization
5 FPS at 12M, up to 60 FPS at 3MP
